title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define project scope, goals, and requirements through stakeholder interviews and research.

title: System Architecture Design for BioHealth_Monitor
description:
Design the overall system architecture for the BioHealth_Monitor project, addressing the following key aspects:

- Implantable device hardware specifications and power requirements (considering miniaturization, biocompatibility, and long battery life)
- Secure and reliable communication between the implant and external systems (using advanced encryption methods and robust connectivity protocols)
- Cloud-based data storage and processing infrastructure (with high availability, scalability, and redundancy; data privacy and security measures should be applied)
- Machine learning models for health prediction and treatment recommendations, including explanatory AI to ensure transparency and understanding of the decision-making process
- User interfaces for monitoring and control (web, mobile), ensuring intuitive user experience, accessibility, and real-time updates
- Integration with healthcare providers and emergency services (APIs, data exchange protocols)
- Scalability to support a large number of users while maintaining performance and reliability (horizontal scaling, load balancing)
- Robust security measures to protect sensitive health data, including encryption, authentication, and authorization mechanisms (multi-factor authentication, role-based access control)
- Fault tolerance and failover mechanisms for critical components (redundancy, automatic recovery, load shedding)
- Regulatory compliance and certifications for medical devices, such as FDA approval (collaborate with legal and regulatory experts)
- Data privacy and consent management mechanisms, ensuring user control over their personal health data (opt-in/out options, data anonymization)
- Over-the-air (OTA) update capabilities for the implantable device (secure and reliable OTA updates)
- Collaboration with other teams to ensure seamless integration of hardware, software, and communication components (regular cross-functional meetings and documentation sharing)

title: Hardware Development
description: Design and develop the implantable device hardware, including sensors, processors, and power management.

title: Software Development
description: Develop the software components for data collection, processing, analysis, and treatment administration.

title: Database Design and Implementation
description: Design and implement the database for storing and retrieving patient data and health records.

title: Security and Privacy Measures for BioHealth_Monitor
description: Implement robust security and privacy measures to protect sensitive patient data, ensure compliance with regulations, and maintain trust in the BioHealth_Monitor system. This task includes: secure data transmission, encryption, access controls, anonymization, regular audits, and a detailed documentation of these measures for transparency. The task is currently under progress by the code-architect. Dependency on 'System Architecture Design' has been met. Once completed, it will be handed over to the security-specialist for final review before deployment. The task description has been updated to include specific security measures and implementation milestones. Upon completion, the task will be assigned to the security-specialist for final review.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop comprehensive test plans and perform thorough testing of all system components and integrations.

title: Deployment and Maintenance Strategy
description: Develop a comprehensive deployment strategy for the BioHealth_Monitor system. This includes infrastructure setup, monitoring, maintenance procedures, disaster recovery mechanisms, update/upgrade processes, documentation, with emphasis on addressing security, performance, scalability, and compliance considerations.

title: Documentation and User Guides
description: Create comprehensive documentation, user guides, and training materials for healthcare professionals and patients.
